alert.note: Alert for Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Grand and Battlement Mesas; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 02 at 4:32PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. ...AVALANCHE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY UNTIL 5 PM TUESDAY... *WHAT...Very dangerous avalanche conditions have developed. Backcountry avalanche danger is HIGH (Level 4 of 5) on Tuesday. *WHERE...Park Range, Flat Top Mountains, Elk Mountains, Ruby Range, Grand Mesa, Uncompahgre Plateau. *WHEN...Monday night through Tuesday January 3. *IMPACTS...Heavy snow and strong winds have created very dangerous avalanche conditions in the backcountry. Large and dangerous avalanches will be very easy to trigger. Avalanches will run naturally. *PRECAUTION/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in backcountry avalanche terrain requires careful decision making. Avoid travel on and under slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. You can find more detailed information at colorado.gov/avalanche
